key_points: Gabby Petito's death ruled a homicide by a Wyoming coroner.
Police continue searching for Petito's missing fiancé in a Florida nature preserve.
Internet users, particularly TikTok influencer Haley Toumaian, believe they helped in finding Petito’s body.
The impact of social media on the investigation of Petito's disappearance and murder remains unclear.
Petito's case has sparked discussions about the types of crimes that garner media and social media attention.
Isaac West, associate professor at Vanderbilt University, discusses engagement in true crime investigations on the internet.
Online discussion platforms like Reddit, TikTok, and Websleuths have been central to discussions and investigations of Petito's case.
Websleuths forums set strict discussion rules to avoid spreading misinformation.
The Websleuths community, including trained forensic artists, has helped solve cases in the past.
The puzzle of the internet's contribution to the location of Petito's body and the broader investigation remains.
spokespersons: Isaac West (Associate Professor, Vanderbilt University, Author of The Serial Effect: True Crime and Contemporary American Culture)
